intro: Cassine paniculata, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Cassine paniculata typically grows in wetlands and along streams, preferring moist, well-drained soils.
